page.title: 02CHILHAM VILLAGE GENERAL
page.content: Chilham is a little village that has a long history. The village was built around a Jacobean castle and a village square.There are several black and white fronted Tudor houses around the square.There are a variety of shops,some of these are the Post Office,Kitchen shop,the Butchers,the gift shop,the Copper Kettle and the Forge Book shop.The village is sometimes used by Pilgrims making pilgrimages to Canterbury Cathederal,but it usually attracts foreign people on their holidays.There are two pubs called the White Horse and the Woolpack Inn.The playing field is run by money from the May Fayre.The village has its own school which is in School Hill.
